resources.string: *Bring the dog!*\n If you’re looking for extra workout motivation, bring your dog with you for an outdoor walk or run. Pups need exercise too.
*Can’t sleep? Blame your cell phone.*\n Staring at your mobile’s screen at bedtime causes people to take longer to reach the deeper stages of sleep and to spend less time in them.
*Graffiti a water bottle.*\n To ensure you’re drinking water all day, use a Sharpie to mark up a water bottle with onehour intervals.

*And the 20/20/20 rule.*\n If you stare at a computer all day with no breaks, try the 20/20/20 rule, which doctors say reduces eye strain and redness: Take 20 seconds to look at something 20 feet away every 20 minutes.
*Talk it out to build muscle.*\n Verbal encouragement can increase the amount of weight you can lift, so pump iron with a supportive friend or work with a trainer.

*Eat before you eat.*\n If you know you’re going to a party, a buffet, or a big dinner and don’t want to totally bust your diet, eat one to two cups of raw veggies beforehand to give your stomach a bit of a head start.
*Bag and freeze smoothie ingredients before you want the smoothie.*\n This way, when you’re craving something sweet, you can toss the ingredients in the blender and drink up—no pre-chopping required.
*Book classes in advance.*\n Booking pilates, yoga, spin, or other one-off classes in advance will always force you to go—otherwise, you get charged, since most require a credit card.
*Smell an orange.*\n Several studies have found that the scent of oranges can reduce stress, improve mood, and make you feel way more awake.
*Shop on a full stomach.*\n Never go grocery shopping when you’re super-hungry. Why? Because everything looks good, so you’ll undoubtedly start throwing in items you normally might not buy.
*Use your commute to relax.*\n Commuting doesn’t have to be stressful: If you take public transportation, download a meditation track or app, close your eyes, and focus on breathing.
*Breakfast person?*\n If you’re a breakfast person, eat it within 30 minutes of waking up.Studies show this can do wonders to boost metabolism.
*Always keep a packed gym bag.*\n In your car or under your desk at work. That way, when the urge to work out hits, you’ll have no excuses.
*Whiten nails with toothpaste.*\n We’ve all heard the one about toothpaste getting rid of zits, but did you know it also can be used to whiten yellowing nails?
*Background do matter!*\n Make your phone or computer background a motivational quote.That way, every time you check your phone, you’ll be motivated to get moving.
